BestSoFar.framework.core.common

Interface EventuallyImmutable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Deletable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Element<I,O>, Processor<I,O>, Workflow<I,O>, WorkflowContainer<I,O>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractElement, AbstractWorkflow, AbstractWorkflowContainer, MutabilityHelper, WorkflowImpl

    public interface EventuallyImmutable
extends Deletable
    An object which eventually becomes immutable.

    It might be immutable from creation, or it might start as mutable and become immutable when fixAsVersion(..) is called.

    The convention to use is X getX() for accessors and EventuallyImmutable withX(newX) for mutators.

    Whilst this.isMutable(), mutators mutate the internal data and return the same object. Once immutable, mutators create a mutable clone and mutations are applied to it, i.e. createMutableClone().withX(newX).

    Mutations can therefore be strung together, e.g. obj.withX(newX).withY(newY).withZ(newZ) will return obj with the mutations if obj.isMutable() or obj.createMutableClone() with the mutations otherwise.

    Immutable objects are made aware of replacements ready to take their place with original.replaceWith(replacement). It then updates its VersionInfo information and generates the Version for the replacement, which is passed in replacement.fixAsVersion(version) and ensures the replacement is finalised (i.e. immutable).

    An object may be finalised multiple times to update it with new version information. No new objects are created in doing so, and the only effect is to save teh new version information.

    See Also:
    MutabilityHelper

      • Methods inherited from interface BestSoFar.framework.core.common.Deletable

        delete, isDeleted

    • Method Detail

      • createMutableClone

        EventuallyImmutable createMutableClone()
        Create a mutable clone of this object. It will remain mutable until passed as a replacement to replaceWith(replacement), at which point fixAsVersion(..) will be called to effect the change to an immutable object.
        Returns:
        a mutable clone.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if this object is still mutable.

      • fixAsVersion

        void fixAsVersion(VersionInfo versionInfo)
        If this object is mutable, this method will make it immutable. In any case, it will save the new version information.

        Calling replaceWith(replacement) creates the new version information and passes it to replacement.beforeFixAsVersion(version).

        Parameters:
        versionInfo - the new version information for this object.

      • isMutable

        boolean isMutable()
        Returns true iff this object is mutable, meaning it was created as mutable and has not been finalised.
        Returns:
        true iff this object is mutable.

      • replaceWith

        void replaceWith(EventuallyImmutable replacement)
        Propose a replacement for this object. How this is handled is determined by the concrete class implementing this.

        This must have no next version, and the replacement must have no previous version - otherwise a RuntimeException is thrown.

        As an example, a sequence of versions between EventuallyImmutable objects start and end can be contracted using 

        start.discardNext();  // start.getNext() == null
 end.discardPrevious(); // end.getPrevious() == null
 start.replaceWith(end);
        Parameters:
        replacement - the replacement to propose.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if this object is still mutable, or has already been replaced or deleted.

      • discardNext

        void discardNext()
        Discards any replacement to this object and ensures this object is not deleted, therefore allowing for it to be replaced by another EventuallyImmutable object. In doing so, it makes the next version discard its previous version.

      • discardPrevious

        void discardPrevious()
        Discard older versions of this, so they may be freed by the garbage collector. In doing so it makes the previous version discard its next version.

      • versionInfo

        VersionInfo versionInfo()
        Gets the VersionInfo object that describes this object. It contains information about this version of the EventuallyImmutable object, and its earlier and later versions.
        Returns:
        the version information about this object.
